thread.title: TV highlights: ‘The Messengers’ face off against the Four Horseman in the series finale
thread.title_full: TV highlights: ‘The Messengers’ face off against the Four Horseman in the series finale - The Washington Post

author: By — Lauren McEwen
title: TV highlights: ‘The Messengers’ face off against the Four Horseman in the series finale
text:
From left, Jessika Van as Koa, Joel Courtney as Peter and JD Pardo as Raul in the series finale of “The Messengers.” (Cathy Kanavy/The CW) By — Lauren McEwen July 23 at 2:53 PM (All times Eastern.)
Magicians Jeff McBride, Greg Frewin, Michael Grandinetti and Piff the Magic Dragon appear on “Masters of Illusion” (CW at 8).
“Ancient Aliens: The Ultimate Evidence” (History at 8) speculates about one of the world’s greatest mysteries: the creation of humankind.
On “Defiance” (Syfy at 8), Amanda, Nolan and Irisa team up with the militia to protect their town against the invading Votanis Collective.
Noah’s girlfriend meets the family, and the Browns try to work in the middle of a snowstorm on “Alaskan Bush People: Off the Grid” (Discover at 8).
“Science of Stupid” (National Geographic at 8:30) looks at water skiing, riding Segways and stage diving.
RETURNING SHOW: A couple of empty nesters begrudgingly consider leaving their family home in the season five premiere of “Love It or List It, Too” (HGTV at 9).
Hosted by actress Natalie Portman, “Great Performances” (PBS at 9) presents the L.A. Philharmonic and conductor Gustavo Dudamel’s tribute to composer John Williams, featuring an interview between Dudamel and Williams, three selections of “Schindler’s List” performed with violinist Itzhak Perlman and more.
A Coney Island-themed shooting gallery is spotlighted on “Redwood Kings” (Animal Planet at 9).
The lead “Killjoys” (Syfy at 9) race against each other to find a rogue bounty hunter named Big Joe.
FINALE WATCH: “The Messengers” (CW at 9) fight to prevent the Four Horsemen from breaking the fifth seal.
The “Treehouse Masters” (Animal Planet at 10) build an elaborate treehouse with a two-story turret near Lake Chelan in Washington state.
Actor Tony Hale stops by “The Soup” (E! at 10).
On “Treasure Quest” (Discovery at 10), the experts face sweltering heat, poisonous snakes and dark caves on their first expedition to Snake Island.
On “Diners, Drive-ins and Dives” (Food Network at 10), Guy Fieri samples a variety of Asian dishes while in Las Vegas, including sushi, udon, Korean barbecue and a new spin on grilled cheese.
“SXSW Comedy With W. Kamau Bell” (Showtime at 11) showcases some of the best stand-up comedians at the SXSW festival, including Rachel Feinstein, Todd Glass, Iliza Shlesinger and Wyatt Cenac.
“The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon” (NBC at 11:30) hosts actors Rachel McAdams, Michael Peña and Robert Klein.
— Lauren McEwen
